greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = LCM of the prime indices in prime factorization of n, a(1) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to lcm's
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
example: Here primepi (A000720) gives the index of its prime argument:
n = 14 = 2 * 7, thus a(14) = lcm(primepi(2), primepi(7)) = lcm(1,4) = 4.
n = 21 = 3 * 7, thus a(21) = lcm(primepi(3), primepi(7)) = lcm(2,4) = 4.
mathematica: Table[Apply[LCM, PrimePi[FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]] ]] + Boole[n == 1], {n, 105}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 14 2017 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A290103 n) (if (= 1 n) n (lcm (A055396 n) (A290103 (A028234 n))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 13 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 13 2017
